name: Ford Mustang (Concept)
description: Early prototype of the Mustang that inspired the production model, showcasing classic pony car lines.

name: Hudson Hornet (Doc Hudson)
description: The legendary 'Fabulous Hudson Hornet' made famous by its racing success and cinematic appearance.

name: Chevrolet Bel Air
description: Iconic â€™57 Bel Air with signature chrome tailfins and a powerful V8 heart under the hood.

name: Volkswagen Beetle
description: The timeless 'people's car' known for its distinctive rounded shape and air-cooled engine.

name: Dodge Charger
description: Muscle car icon with aggressive styling and HEMI power that defined an era of American performance.

name: Jaguar E-Type
description: Often hailed as one of the most beautiful cars ever made, with stunning curves and a top speed over 150 mph.

name: Mercedes-Benz 300SL Gullwing
description: Rare and exquisite, with distinctive gullwing doors and pioneering fuel-injection technology.

name: Chevrolet Corvette C1
description: America's first production sports car with a fiberglass body and distinctive two-tone color scheme.

name: Aston Martin DB5
description: British grand tourer made famous by its appearances in James Bond films, featuring elegant styling.

name: Ferrari 275 GTB
description: A rare Italian masterpiece with a Colombo V12 engine and graceful, aerodynamic bodywork.

name: Lincoln Continental
description: Luxury flagship sedan known for its suicide doors and refined V8 performance.

name: Pontiac GTO
description: Often credited as the first true muscle car, packing a powerful V8 and sporty styling.

name: Cadillac Eldorado
description: Lavish American luxury car with iconic tailfins and a plush, spacious interior.

name: Shelby Cobra 427
description: High-performance roadster combining British chassis with American V8 power for blistering acceleration.

name: Chevrolet Camaro SS
description: First-generation Camaro in Super Sport trim with performance suspension and a bold front grille.
